column4: astyx,ROsmanov: by using gksudo nautilus,i can copy/paste now,every time i want to do like this only,how can i give them root permission?
what is /mount/point what should i type here, whether i have to type /dev/sda3 like that?
mount point is some (usually empty) directory.  Create one with « sudo mkdir /media/mynewshinymountpoint » and then use that
you can do « mount /dev/sda1 /media/sda1 » but you have to create /media/sda1 first.  To create /media/sda1, you do « mkdir /media/sda1 »
